body.name: Outta the Frying Pan: A WWII Submarine Adventure Novel (USS Bull Shark Naval Thriller series Book 7)
body.description: The better you are, the more is asked of you… and the higher the heat…Bull Shark and S-52 have just attacked a large bombardment fleet off the coast of Guadalcanal. And although they didn’t stop Henderson from being shelled, they might have at least curtailed it. Yet the Japanese are undaunted and more determined than ever… and the Empire has its sights set on some of its most deadly foes.Upon conferring with General Vandegrift ashore, Captains Turner and Waters are informed that a group of refugees are trapped on New Ireland, just across the sound from Rabaul. Elmer Williams, recently flown in from Pearl, delivers orders from Webster Clayton and Admiral Nimitz to go and get them off before they’re found by Japanese troops and executed. and they’re being joined by some old friends.Al Decker and his Marine Raider unit are put aboard Bull Shark and will go ashore to locate and rescue the Australian civilians. However, both submarines are unaware that they’re sailing into a large and complex spider’s web… a web spun from treachery, deceit and deadly intent. Now the race is on… can the boats and Decker’s men get ashore and get off again before The Sensei can close his trap and seal their fates? Or will they all be squeezed to death in the iron grip of Hirohito’s lust for power?Guns thunder, depth charges boom and torpedoes streak through the sea in this action-packed naval adventure-thriller! Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Read the entire series! Want more, great read could not put it down! Readied start with the first book and read each one in order. Worth your time and money!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good action, but I believe at one point I read that was the bull Shark had 4" guns and later she had 5" inches. Not a big thing compared to the entire book. Good yarn. Well done

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This series is absolutely outstanding. It’s packed with adventure, intrigue and all around entertainment. I loved the plotting and the levity that’s part of this series. It’s a must read if you want to be kept on the edge of your seat…….real page turners.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excellent story enjoy reading about Captain Turner. I'M always short of words to finish. Admire writers talent, thank him for the pleasure I get from it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hate to see it end
reviews.reviewText: I hate to see this series come to an end. It was really a barnburner. He did give some hope that there may be more. I love Ww2 Pacific war history and his books make it highly interesting. He's got 2 more series along those lines, so I will be reading them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Again, Scott has brought us into the middle of a vibrant battle and had us join the team. I am sorry to see my friends go. I do hope art and Joan get back together safely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another Wonderful Bull Shark Adventure
reviews.reviewText: Out of the Frying Pan is the latest in the Art Turner Bull Shark series. There are good guys and bad guys in this episode and the story does not disappoint!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding book number 7
reviews.reviewText: As expected, this was an excellent read. Very hard to put down and the characters were developed to perfection.Thank you Scott.
Great adventure and storyline, and I love these characters. I'm already looking forward to the next book in this series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Could not put this o e down a gripping tale of dark g do with betrayal success and tragedy all in the telly g
